full_text:
Rating Basics

Lesson
objectives ¢ Describe what rating is in the context of

PolicyCenter

¢ Explain the role of the actuary or rating
analyst during an implementation

¢ List the content needed to implement a rating
solution in PolicyCenter

On my next project, I’m working with
PolicyCenter Rating Management. Can you give
me an overview of how Guidewire rating works?

I Business overview Gi

Mainframe Policy Administration
System (PolicyCenter)

I Role of the actuary or rating analyst G

¢ During implementation, actuaries or
rating analysts provide rating-specific
content to configuration developers

» ¢ The existing format may not be
appropriate for Guidewire rating

¢ The actuary or rating analyst works
with implementation experts to move
“old” rating content format to
PolicyCenter-ready format while
keeping the rating manual the same

I PolicyCenter rating overview G

Input: data
(for example: Output: Policy cost

make, model of a Coverage cost,
Car, year, garage taxes, fees
location)

Rating Engine

* Rating is the process of determining the cost of a policy

¢ Rating output results in information representing the prices for various portions of
the policies such as coverage costs, taxes or fees

I Rating components Gi

Rating Engine

fh

a
ce+ [E+ @

Rate tables and Rate book Rate routines
rate table
defintions v
Parameter Set

I Preparing content for PolicyCenter rating Gi

« Rate Flow: the logic in the rating engine that does the premium calculation
¢ Rate Routines: the algorithms to calculate premium
¢ Rate Tables: the rating content in a lookup format

¢ Rate Books: a group of rate tables and rate routines

I Rating process diagram 9 G

@—-cii &

Quote Rating Engine selects a Rate Book. The Rating Engine calls a Rate
Routine for the Cost Item
(for example, a Coverage)

« =
Return them to the calling policy transaction (Quote) G

Constructs the corresponding
Worksheet with the calculated results

I Rating engine and rate flow Gi

Rating Engine * The base implementation of the
rating engine uses a hierarchy of
classes and flexible logic
| (e) ¢ The rate flow is the logic in the rating
engine plugin that calculates the
premium

¢ The rating engine and rate flow logic
configuration specifics are covered in
the Rating Configuration course

Rate Flow

I Rate tables and rate table definitions Gi

¢ Arate table contains static rates in a
table format consisting of one or
more rows

¢ Rate tables contain columns
representing parameters used to look
up a value, known as a factor

¢ Arate table definition describes the
parameters and the factors for a
particular rate table

I Rate routines Gi

¢ Arate routine defines steps for
calculating a cost for coverage, tax,
and other costs on a policy

¢ Arate routine step can specify:
« Mathematical operations
* Logic conditions

« Variable assignment from a rate table
lookup

I Rate books Gi

¢ Arate book is a group of rate tables
and rate routines

« Rate books can be accessed from
Administration tab > Rating >
Rate Books

Question G

_~ — List the three main components in PolicyCenter Rating Management.

4
¢
¢

SoS oD DD DDS De Say

Answer Gi

_~ — List the three main components in PolicyCenter Rating Management.

¢
¢
¢

For an efficient implementation, rating specialists and actuaries should identify rate
flow, rate tables, rate routines. Note: rate routines use parameter sets.

Sop DD DD SDSS oe

¢ List the content needed to implement a rating
